#summary Description of the Zend Framework skeleton in Rend.
#labels Phase-Implementation,Release-2.0

= Zend Framework Skeleton =

Currently, the Zend Framework does not have an automatic tool for setting up a Zend Framework based project. While they are creating tools to solve this problem ([http://framework.zend.com/wiki/display/ZFPROP/Zend_Build+-+Wil+Sinclair Zend_Build]), Rend provides a simple directory structure out of the box.

The structure of the Rend source code files and directories is setup to match the new, [http://framework.zend.com/wiki/display/ZFPROP/Zend+Framework+Default+Project+Structure+-+Wil+Sinclair proposed Zend Controller modular directory structure].

 * application
   * apis
   * config
   * controllers
     * helpers
   * layouts
     * filters
     * helpers
     * scripts
   * models
   * _modules_
   * view
     * filters
     * helpers
     * scripts
   * bootstrap.php
 * data
   * cache
   * indexes
   * locales
   * logs
   * sessions
   * uploads
 * docs
 * library
   * Project
   * Rend
   * Zend
 * public
   * css
   * js
   * images
   * .htaccess
   * index.php
 * scripts
   * jobs
   * build
 * temp
 * tests

All this allows you to begin developing your application immediately, without having to do the setup of a Zend Framework site.
